summary: This is an FBI Legal Attaché letter from the U.S. Embassy in Sydney to the Australian Federal Police, coordinating an interview with a U.S. citizen victim/witness in Australia. The document outlines the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of underage girls, details the victim's allegations of being trafficked by Epstein to have sex with his associates, and requests AFP assistance for FBI agents to travel to Sydney to interview her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI investigation for manipulating underage girls to perform massages and sexual acts at his residence, and for trafficking a specific victim to have sex with his associates.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly recruited the victim, paid for her apartment in exchange for sex, and later instructed her to have sex with his numerous associates.

events.title: Victim Contacts U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: The victim contacted the United States Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach, Florida, and expressed willingness to speak with investigators about her activities with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled FBI Interview in Sydney
events.description: FBI agents planned to fly to Sydney, Australia, to conduct an in-depth interview with the victim at the U.S. Consulate regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI Locates Victim in Australia
events.description: FBI Miami conducted an investigation which determined the victim was residing in Australia, leading to coordination with the FBI Legal Attaché Office in Canberra.

keyFacts: The FBI was investigating Jeffrey Epstein for manipulating underage girls from local high schools to perform massages and sexual acts at his residence, with victims recruited by other underage females and paid $200-$1000.

A specific victim, who was 17 at the time, was allegedly provided an apartment by Epstein in exchange for sex and was later instructed by him to have sex with his numerous associates both in the U.S. and overseas.

The victim, now residing in Australia, contacted U.S. authorities in 2011, identified several subjects by name, claimed to have records supporting her allegations, and could identify other underage women involved with Epstein.
The FBI coordinated with Australian authorities to arrange for agents to fly to Sydney to conduct a detailed interview with the victim on March 17, 2011.
A prior victim, who was 14 at the time, witnessed Epstein having sexual intercourse with the 17-year-old victim mentioned in the document.
